docs.lead_paragraph: Ending a protracted stalemate, Gov. George E. Pataki and legislative leaders today agreed on legislation under which state health officials would for the first time tell all parents the results of H.I.V. tests performed on their newborns. The deal comes nearly a year after the Governor adopted an interim measure that had simply offered parents the opportunity to learn the results of those tests.

headline.main: Pataki and Lawmakers Agree on Plan for Testing Newborns for AIDS Virus

docs.snippet: Ending a protracted stalemate, Gov. George E. Pataki and legislative leaders  today agreed on legislation under which state health officials would for the first time tell all parents the results of H.I.V. tests performed on their newborns.        ...

docs.lead_paragraph: Tony Moreno is an outgoing, churchgoing man and the father of three. But for most of the last five years, Mr. Moreno put in 12-hour workdays, including all of his Sundays, as a machine operator here at Lucent Technologies.

headline.main: Factories That Never Close Are Scrapping 5-Day Week

docs.snippet: Tony Moreno is an outgoing, churchgoing man and the father of three.         But for most of the last five years, Mr. Moreno put in 12-hour workdays, including all of his Sundays, as a machine operator here at Lucent Technologies.

docs.lead_paragraph: AS of early last month, the county had confirmed nine cases of raccoon rabies since the first of the year, and health officials worried that an epidemic of the disease first reported in 1991 may be revisiting Westchester. On another front, officials reported that the incidence of Lyme disease continued unabated, with the county tallying 8,274 cases since 1986. Similarly, the incidence of tuberculosis -- about 140 new cases last year -- continued its upward trend as doctors and health officials remained powerless in the face of new and more virulent strains that become increasingly resistant to antibiotics.

headline.main: Health Issues That Concern the County the Most
